page.title: 07NOX BLACKSMITH
page.content:
{The Nox blacksmith}continues a{family {trade}that began with his grandfather in 1860.The present blacksmith has worked at Nox for 60 years. Although now retired he still shoes horses for a few regular customers.
{Shoeing}process.The horse shoes are made by the blacksmith prior to the horse's visit.The old shoes are removed,the hooves trimmed and cleaned.Each new shoe is heated, placed on the hoof to make a print then removed for final moulding to make a good fit.The shoe is then nailed to the horse's hoof.The whole process of shoeing a horse takes about one hour.
